rComments: Pure memorization course of peoples opinions. That's it. If you do not answer every part of his question in explicit word-for-word accuracy, good luck passing. Stuck up and rude, his course instructions are very unclear on his own personal website which I do not understand why he uses.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', 'Lecture heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Worst class I have ever taken. Gives questions ahead of time for midterms & exams, but unless you memorize word for word, there is no chance in getting anything close to a 4.0. Does not post slides either, therefore you have to be there every class, copying his slides, or taking pictures because he flies through them. Also very rude!
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Test heavy', 'Tough grader']

rComments: For the midterm he gives you 20 long answer questions in advance and ten will be on the test (lots of memorization, but study in advance to do well). He has a good dry sense of humour. He does not post powerpoints online so going to class is essential (it helps to have friends in the class to bail you out when you missed something important).

In my experience with Pierre, his courses follow the same scheme: 5% proposal, 20% midterm, 40% final essay, and 35% exam. For the essay you can work in groups up to three, but you are expected to write more pages (one person - 15 pages, two - 20, three - 25). For the essay you can choose any topic relevant to the course but it is hard to get an A.

This prof is one of my top 3 worse instructors. The prof is so biased &forces students to learn bias content, especially by ignoring the students when they ask questions in class (He always says he will cover the material later). He is also rude and has no interest in helping students. He will tell people to shut up at least 3 times each class.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'So many papers', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Would not take any of his courses again.

His class is all about you. He gives the questions ahead of time, and if you do your work, you're golden. So, if you put in the effort, a 4.0 is completely possible (personal experience). So yeah, he's a good prof if you're good at memorizing : ) And even if you're not, you can understand the material and do well enough too!

Pierre Desrochers' teaching style is very straight forward. He includes interesting facts and his own opinion on many topics. A lot of students are complaining that the course is pure memorization, it's not. He does give questions ahead of time for midterm/exam, if you pay attention and study you will LEARN the material and not have to memorize it.

Great prof! Tells you exactly what notes to take during class, gives you the questions well in advance and the rest is up to you. Everyone who says he's a bad prof is wrong. I actually learn things in his class as opposed to my other classes where I just sit and do nothing. He also gives you an opportunity to explore your own ideas through an essay
He is funny and interesting. Shows videos and other interesting stuff in class. I'm all for this guy!

He gives the questions for tests & exams. Although each question has 5-10 parts. They're all answers consisting of a few words. So if you just memorize them, you're good. He tells you what lecture notes you need to copy down for the tests/exams. Very good.

He appears as if he is a laid back guy, but when it comes to the test people get  decimated. Apparently we were the worst year for the midterm (many 40's). Just pure memorization with unrealistic expectations for the amount of information that needs to be regurgitated.

He does not follow the idea of what university stands for. University stands for exploring ideas, understanding and most importantly your own thinking. Forcing people into memorizing somebody's controversial opinion is complete opposite of what university experience should be, especially in social geography that is generally open minded.

If you can memorize 20-40 questions in explicit detail, then yo're one step closer to getting that 4.0. Pure memorization - he posts questions prior to the tests where you can find answers to in the readings (He posts online) and his lectures (Doesn't post online). Easy, but he is meh - minimal help! This course is ALL YOU & hard work..
I was skeptical n taking his course but he is a very nice man. Very good prof. Like all profs some like him others not soo much but if you visit his office, he's great help
Very Rude. Tests based purely on memorization, which is not what learning is about. Totally a waste of money. Don't take any of his classes.
He takes classes that could be good and destroys them. No learning involved at all. Purely memorization. If you can not memorize slides, which are not given, word for word then you will fail.

Class starts out boring, and gets interesting after the midterm. Made me look at globalization in a new way. Lectures can get very boring, but he tells you EXACTLY what to write. Attend lecture and there is ZERO reason not to get 90%+ in the class. He literally gives you the questions on the exam/midterm and answers in class.

He is extremely rude. Will literally make you feel stupid for asking a question that is confusing you. Course is okay, just sure you have enough writing material when you walking the lecture cuz he is going to make you write like no tmrw he will sometimes embarrass you for walking in late infront of the 300 students.
wASTE OF A LECTURE. MAJORITY OF LECTURE WAS BASED ON THE TEXT. EXAM- PURE MEMORIZATION
Awesome. Great slides and videos. Two thumbs up.

While his classes are great, he is very rude when it comes to answering some questions and also discriminates against people of a certain race as part of his lectures/even posted a reading that targetted a certain group/ethnicity.

WELL HES OKAY....its all about memorization.  If you talk to someone from the years before, and get the questions from them you are gold come term test and exam time.  Finding GOOD answers for the questions could take some time.  doesnt give slides, and laptop is crucial!  GOOD LUCK...hes not that bad
One of the best Profs at UTM. Class act.

What a waste of money. Course content COULD have been interesting, but lecture style and arrogance killed it. Seems like the prof is out of place teaching geography, and his own interests seem to lie elsewhere. Either that, or he is just unpleasant.

Desrochers is a really good. His slides are very well organized, the material is amazing and he caters to students who believe in HARD WORK. Aside from the crappy room (not his fault), the course was really good. T&G was good... but you have to work and do the questions to do well. Overall, amazing

Awful lecture style, poor learning experience. Does not communicate clearly, and tests rely solely on memory work rather than critical reasoning. Not an enjoyable or informative educational experience.
